{"step_by_step_thinking": "The foramen caecum is a small opening located at the midline of the skull. To determine where it is seen, we can evaluate each option.

B. The tongue is a muscular organ located in the oral cavity. It does not contain the foramen caecum. 

C. The sphenoid bone is a cranial bone located at the base of the skull. It does not contain the foramen caecum. 

D. Option 1 and 2 is incorrect because neither the ethmoid bone nor the tongue contain the foramen caecum.
